metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

Documentation_Link.Text:
FREE AIR CO2 ENRICHMENT (FACE) DATA REPORT: WEATHER ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
QUALITY-ASSURANCE CHECKS AND DATA-PROCESSING ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY THE FACE PROJECT AND CDIAC -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
For all variables in all files, the range of values was checked for unrealistic large or small values. Equipment calibration fluctuations can result in values of relative humidity exceeding 100% and negative PAR and pyranometer values. Relative humidity values greater than 100 are set equal to 100. PAR and pyranometer values between 0 and -10 are set equal to 0, and values less than -10 are set to missing.
Daily statistics were calculated only for those variables with at least 12 good hourly values, and the calculation of daily statistics for the variables, PAR2m, PAR22m, and PYRAN, required 12 good daylight hours. Otherwise, the daily values were set to missing.
X-Y scattergrams of all variables were used to check for outliers, and the scattergrams were evaluated for consistency of the recorded data among the data loggers.
LIST OF FILES -------------
Weather data are available for 1999-2010. There is an hourly and a daily file for each of the six plots (rings) on the FACE site, giving a total of 12 files for each year.
This report documents 144 files with filenames of the form rA_wB_C.dat, where A denotes the FACE ring (1 through 6), B has values of d = daily or h = hourly, and C denotes the year (1999 through 2010).
There are also gap-filled hourly and daily files for each of the six plots on the FACE site for 1999-2008. These data are located in the directory /ftp/pub/FACE/ornldata/weather/gap_filled_data. The format of the gap-filled files is identical to the non-gap-filled files. The filenames have the form rA_wB_gap_C.dat. There are no missing values in these files.
The files are as follows:

DESCRIPTION and FORMAT OF THE ASCII DATA FILES ----------------------------------------------
These data files include air temperature, relative humidity, and PAR values recorded near the center of each of six plots at 2m height. Soil temperature at 10 cm depth is recorded at two locations between plots, and air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed, precipitation, PAR, and pyranometer data are recorded above the canopy (22m) on two of the plots. Soil temperature and the variables recorded above the canopy are averaged to represent site conditions for the six plots, and these site variables are included in each of the weather data files.
Contents and format of the hourly files, r*_wh_*.dat.
Variable Variable Variable Starting Ending Units Definition and type width column column comments
YEAR Integer 4 1 4 y Year DOY Integer 3 6 8 d Day of the year (1 = 1 January, ..., 365 or 366 = 31 December) HOUR Integer 2 10 11 h Hour ATMEAN2m Real 10 14 23 deg C Hourly mean air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground ATMIN2m Real 10 24 33 deg C Hourly minimum air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground ATMAX2m Real 10 34 43 deg C Hourly maximum air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground RH2m Real 10 44 53 % Hourly mean relative humidity, measured at 2m above the ground PAR2m Real 10 54 63 umol/m2/s Mean incident photosynthetically active radiation, measured at 2m above the ground STMEAN Real 10 64 73 deg C Hourly mean soil temperature (10-cm depth) STMIN Real 10 74 83 deg C Hourly minimum soil temperature (10-cm depth) STMAX Real 10 84 93 deg C Hourly maximum soil temperature (10-cm depth) ATMEAN22m Real 10 94 103 deg C Hourly mean air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground ATMIN22m Real 12 104 115 deg C Hourly minimum air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground ATMAX22m Real 12 116 127 deg C Hourly maximum air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground RH22m Real 12 128 139 % Hourly mean relative humidity, measured at 22m above the ground PAR22m Real 12 140 151 umol/m2/s Mean incident photosynthetically active radiation, measured at 22m above the ground PYRAN Real 10 152 161 W/m2 Integrated incident total radiation, measured at 22m above the ground RAIN Real 10 162 171 mm Hourly total rain WIND Real 10 172 181 m/s Mean hourly wind speed
********
Contents and format of the daily files, r*_wd_*.dat.
Variable Variable Variable Starting Ending Units Definition and type width column column contents
YEAR Integer 4 1 4 y Year DOY Integer 3 6 8 d Day of the year (1 = 1 January, ..., 365 or 366 = 31 December) ATMEAN2m Real 10 14 23 deg C Daily mean air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground ATMIN2m Real 10 24 33 deg C Daily minimum air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground ATMAX2m Real 10 34 43 deg C Daily maximum air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground RH2m Real 10 44 53 % Daily mean relative humidity, measured at 2m above the ground PAR2m Real 10 54 63 mol/m2/d Integrated incident photosynthetically active radiation, measured at 2m above the ground STMEAN Real 10 64 73 deg C Daily mean soil temperature (10-cm depth) STMIN Real 10 74 83 deg C Daily minimum soil temperature (10-cm depth) STMAX Real 10 84 93 deg C Daily maximum soil temperature (10-cm depth) ATMEAN22m Real 10 94 103 deg C Daily mean air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground ATMIN22m Real 12 104 115 deg C Daily minimum air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground ATMAX22m Real 12 116 127 deg C Daily maximum air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground RH22m Real 12 128 139 % Daily mean relative humidity, measured at 22m above the ground PAR22m Real 12 140 151 mol/m2/d Integrated incident photosynthetically active radiation, measured at 22m above the ground PYRAN Real 10 152 161 W/m2 Integrated incident total radiation, measured at 22m above the ground RAIN Real 10 162 171 mm Daily total rain (sum of hourly values) WIND Real 10 172 181 m/s Mean daily wind speed
PARTIAL LISTINGS OF THE ASCII DATA FILES ----------------------------------------
The missing-value indicators in these files are -99.999 for variables ATMEAN2m, ATMIN2m, ATMAX2m, STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX, ATMEAN22m, ATMIN22m, and ATMAX22m; and -99.99 for variables RH2m, RH22m, RAIN, WIND, PAR2m, PAR22m, and PYRAN.

SPREADSHEET SOFTWARE TO ACCESS THE DATA --------------------------------------------
Since these hourly and daily weather files are space-delimited ASCII text, the files can be imported to spreadsheet software such as Excel or Lotus for processing. A search and replace command can be used to replace the missing values of -99.99 and -99.999 with appropriate missing values for the software being used.
SAS, FORTRAN, and C CODES TO ACCESS THE DATA --------------------------------------------
The following is SAS code to read hourly files, r*_wh_*.dat.
/* SAS CODE TO READ FILE r1_wh_2001.dat. */
DATA METDAT;
INFILE "r1_wh_2001.dat";
IF _N_ = 1 THEN DO; INPUT ////////; /* READ HEADER INFORMATION */ END;
INPUT YEAR DOY HOUR ATMEAN2M ATMIN2M ATMAX2M RH2M PAR2M STMEAN STMIN STMAX ATMEAN22M ATMIN22M ATMAX22M RH22M PAR22M PYRAN RAIN WIND;
RUN;
**********
The following is Fortran code to read hourly files, r*_wh_*.dat.
PROGRAM METDAT
C FORTRAN CODE TO READ THE FILE r1_wh_2001.dat.
REAL ATMEAN2M, ATMIN2M, ATMAX2M, RH2M, PAR2M, STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX REAL ATMEAN22M, ATMIN22M, ATMAX22M, RH22M, PAR22M, PYRAN REAL RAIN, WIND
INTEGER YEAR, DOY, HOUR
CHARACTER*182 HEADER
OPEN(UNIT = 2, FILE = 'r1_wh_2001.dat', STATUS = 'OLD')
DO I = 1,9 READ(2,'(A)') HEADER ENDDO
10 READ(2,*, END = 20) # YEAR, DOY, HOUR, ATMEAN2M, ATMIN2M, ATMAX2M, RH2M, PAR2M, # STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX, ATMEAN22M, ATMIN22M, ATMAX22M, # RH22M, PAR22M, PYRAN, RAIN, WIND
GO TO 10
20 CLOSE(2)
STOP END
**********
The following is C code to read hourly files, r*_wh_*.dat.
#include stdio.h #include stdlib.h #include string.h
/* C program to read r1_wh_2001.dat. */
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
int rec; int YEAR, DOY, HOUR;
float ATMEAN2m, ATMIN2m, ATMAX2m, RH2m, PAR2m, STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX; float ATMEAN22m, ATMIN22m, ATMAX22m, RH22m, PAR22m, PYRAN, RAIN, WIND;
char header[184];
FILE *met_fp;
if((met_fp = fopen("./r1_wh_2001.dat", "r")) == NULL) { fprintf(stderr, "Error opening file r1_wh_2001.dat.\n"); exit(EXIT_FAILURE); }
for(rec = 1; rec = 9; rec++) { fgets(header, 183, met_fp); header[strlen(header)] = '\0'; }
while(!feof(met_fp)) { if (fscanf(met_fp, "%d %d %d %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f\n", &YEAR, &DOY, &HOUR, &ATMEAN2m, &ATMIN2m, &ATMAX2m, &RH2m, &PAR2m, &STMEAN, &STMIN, &STMAX, &ATMEAN22m, &ATMIN22m, &ATMAX22m, &RH22m, &PAR22m, &PYRAN, &RAIN, &WIND) == 19); else fprintf(stderr, "Check the number of variables in r1_wh_2001.dat\n"); }
return; }

CDIAC.Thematic_area: Vegetation response to CO2 and Climate

Site_info.Site_name: Oak Ridge National Laboratory FACE Experiment

CDIAC.Descriptive_file:
http://cdiac.ess-dive.lbl.gov/ftp/FACE/ornldata/weather/weather.txt FREE AIR CO2 ENRICHMENT (FACE) DATA REPORT: WEATHER ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
QUALITY-ASSURANCE CHECKS AND DATA-PROCESSING ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY THE FACE PROJECT AND CDIAC -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
For all variables in all files, the range of values was checked for unrealistic large or small values. Equipment calibration fluctuations can result in values of relative humidity exceeding 100% and negative PAR and pyranometer values. Relative humidity values greater than 100 are set equal to 100. PAR and pyranometer values between 0 and -10 are set equal to 0, and values less than -10 are set to missing.
Daily statistics were calculated only for those variables with at least 12 good hourly values, and the calculation of daily statistics for the variables, PAR2m, PAR22m, and PYRAN, required 12 good daylight hours. Otherwise, the daily values were set to missing.
X-Y scattergrams of all variables were used to check for outliers, and the scattergrams were evaluated for consistency of the recorded data among the data loggers.
LIST OF FILES -------------
Weather data are available for 1999-2010. There is an hourly and a daily file for each of the six plots (rings) on the FACE site, giving a total of 12 files for each year.
This report documents 144 files with filenames of the form rA_wB_C.dat, where A denotes the FACE ring (1 through 6), B has values of d = daily or h = hourly, and C denotes the year (1999 through 2010).
There are also gap-filled hourly and daily files for each of the six plots on the FACE site for 1999-2008. These data are located in the directory /ftp/pub/FACE/ornldata/weather/gap_filled_data. The format of the gap-filled files is identical to the non-gap-filled files. The filenames have the form rA_wB_gap_C.dat. There are no missing values in these files.

DESCRIPTION and FORMAT OF THE ASCII DATA FILES ----------------------------------------------
These data files include air temperature, relative humidity, and PAR values recorded near the center of each of six plots at 2m height. Soil temperature at 10 cm depth is recorded at two locations between plots, and air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed, precipitation, PAR, and pyranometer data are recorded above the canopy (22m) on two of the plots. Soil temperature and the variables recorded above the canopy are averaged to represent site conditions for the six plots, and these site variables are included in each of the weather data files.
Contents and format of the hourly files, r*_wh_*.dat.
Variable Variable Variable Starting Ending Units Definition and type width column column comments
YEAR Integer 4 1 4 y Year DOY Integer 3 6 8 d Day of the year (1 = 1 January, ..., 365 or 366 = 31 December) HOUR Integer 2 10 11 h Hour ATMEAN2m Real 10 14 23 deg C Hourly mean air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground ATMIN2m Real 10 24 33 deg C Hourly minimum air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground ATMAX2m Real 10 34 43 deg C Hourly maximum air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground RH2m Real 10 44 53 % Hourly mean relative humidity, measured at 2m above the ground PAR2m Real 10 54 63 umol/m2/s Mean incident photosynthetically active radiation, measured at 2m above the ground STMEAN Real 10 64 73 deg C Hourly mean soil temperature (10-cm depth) STMIN Real 10 74 83 deg C Hourly minimum soil temperature (10-cm depth) STMAX Real 10 84 93 deg C Hourly maximum soil temperature (10-cm depth) ATMEAN22m Real 10 94 103 deg C Hourly mean air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground ATMIN22m Real 12 104 115 deg C Hourly minimum air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground ATMAX22m Real 12 116 127 deg C Hourly maximum air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground RH22m Real 12 128 139 % Hourly mean relative humidity, measured at 22m above the ground PAR22m Real 12 140 151 umol/m2/s Mean incident photosynthetically active radiation, measured at 22m above the ground PYRAN Real 10 152 161 W/m2 Integrated incident total radiation, measured at 22m above the ground RAIN Real 10 162 171 mm Hourly total rain WIND Real 10 172 181 m/s Mean hourly wind speed
********
Contents and format of the daily files, r*_wd_*.dat.
Variable Variable Variable Starting Ending Units Definition and type width column column contents
YEAR Integer 4 1 4 y Year DOY Integer 3 6 8 d Day of the year (1 = 1 January, ..., 365 or 366 = 31 December) ATMEAN2m Real 10 14 23 deg C Daily mean air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground ATMIN2m Real 10 24 33 deg C Daily minimum air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground ATMAX2m Real 10 34 43 deg C Daily maximum air temperature, measured at 2m above the ground RH2m Real 10 44 53 % Daily mean relative humidity, measured at 2m above the ground PAR2m Real 10 54 63 mol/m2/d Integrated incident photosynthetically active radiation, measured at 2m above the ground STMEAN Real 10 64 73 deg C Daily mean soil temperature (10-cm depth) STMIN Real 10 74 83 deg C Daily minimum soil temperature (10-cm depth) STMAX Real 10 84 93 deg C Daily maximum soil temperature (10-cm depth) ATMEAN22m Real 10 94 103 deg C Daily mean air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground ATMIN22m Real 12 104 115 deg C Daily minimum air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground ATMAX22m Real 12 116 127 deg C Daily maximum air temperature, measured at 22m above the ground RH22m Real 12 128 139 % Daily mean relative humidity, measured at 22m above the ground PAR22m Real 12 140 151 mol/m2/d Integrated incident photosynthetically active radiation, measured at 22m above the ground PYRAN Real 10 152 161 W/m2 Integrated incident total radiation, measured at 22m above the ground RAIN Real 10 162 171 mm Daily total rain (sum of hourly values) WIND Real 10 172 181 m/s Mean daily wind speed
PARTIAL LISTINGS OF THE ASCII DATA FILES ----------------------------------------
The missing-value indicators in these files are -99.999 for variables ATMEAN2m, ATMIN2m, ATMAX2m, STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX, ATMEAN22m, ATMIN22m, and ATMAX22m; and -99.99 for variables RH2m, RH22m, RAIN, WIND, PAR2m, PAR22m, and PYRAN.

SPREADSHEET SOFTWARE TO ACCESS THE DATA --------------------------------------------
Since these hourly and daily weather files are space-delimited ASCII text, the files can be imported to spreadsheet software such as Excel or Lotus for processing. A search and replace command can be used to replace the missing values of -99.99 and -99.999 with appropriate missing values for the software being used.
SAS, FORTRAN, and C CODES TO ACCESS THE DATA --------------------------------------------
The following is SAS code to read hourly files, r*_wh_*.dat.
/* SAS CODE TO READ FILE r1_wh_2001.dat. */
DATA METDAT;
INFILE "r1_wh_2001.dat";
IF _N_ = 1 THEN DO; INPUT ////////; /* READ HEADER INFORMATION */ END;
INPUT YEAR DOY HOUR ATMEAN2M ATMIN2M ATMAX2M RH2M PAR2M STMEAN STMIN STMAX ATMEAN22M ATMIN22M ATMAX22M RH22M PAR22M PYRAN RAIN WIND;
RUN;
**********
The following is Fortran code to read hourly files, r*_wh_*.dat.
PROGRAM METDAT
C FORTRAN CODE TO READ THE FILE r1_wh_2001.dat.
REAL ATMEAN2M, ATMIN2M, ATMAX2M, RH2M, PAR2M, STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX REAL ATMEAN22M, ATMIN22M, ATMAX22M, RH22M, PAR22M, PYRAN REAL RAIN, WIND
INTEGER YEAR, DOY, HOUR
CHARACTER*182 HEADER
OPEN(UNIT = 2, FILE = 'r1_wh_2001.dat', STATUS = 'OLD')
DO I = 1,9 READ(2,'(A)') HEADER ENDDO
10 READ(2,*, END = 20) # YEAR, DOY, HOUR, ATMEAN2M, ATMIN2M, ATMAX2M, RH2M, PAR2M, # STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX, ATMEAN22M, ATMIN22M, ATMAX22M, # RH22M, PAR22M, PYRAN, RAIN, WIND
GO TO 10
20 CLOSE(2)
STOP END
**********
The following is C code to read hourly files, r*_wh_*.dat.
#include stdio.h #include stdlib.h #include string.h
/* C program to read r1_wh_2001.dat. */
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
int rec; int YEAR, DOY, HOUR;
float ATMEAN2m, ATMIN2m, ATMAX2m, RH2m, PAR2m, STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX; float ATMEAN22m, ATMIN22m, ATMAX22m, RH22m, PAR22m, PYRAN, RAIN, WIND;
char header[184];
FILE *met_fp;
if((met_fp = fopen("./r1_wh_2001.dat", "r")) == NULL) { fprintf(stderr, "Error opening file r1_wh_2001.dat.\n"); exit(EXIT_FAILURE); }
for(rec = 1; rec = 9; rec++) { fgets(header, 183, met_fp); header[strlen(header)] = '\0'; }
while(!feof(met_fp)) { if (fscanf(met_fp, "%d %d %d %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f\n", &YEAR, &DOY, &HOUR, &ATMEAN2m, &ATMIN2m, &ATMAX2m, &RH2m, &PAR2m, &STMEAN, &STMIN, &STMAX, &ATMEAN22m, &ATMIN22m, &ATMAX22m, &RH22m, &PAR22m, &PYRAN, &RAIN, &WIND) == 19); else fprintf(stderr, "Check the number of variables in r1_wh_2001.dat\n"); }
return; }
**********
The following is SAS code to read daily files, r*_wd_*.dat.
/* SAS CODE TO READ FILE r1_wd_2001.dat. */
DATA METDAT;
INFILE "r1_wd_2001.dat";
IF _N_ = 1 THEN DO; INPUT ////////; /* READ HEADER INFORMATION */ END;
INPUT YEAR DOY ATMEAN2M ATMIN2M ATMAX2M RH2M PAR2M STMEAN STMIN STMAX ATMEAN22M ATMIN22M ATMAX22M RH22M PAR22M PYRAN RAIN WIND;
RUN;

The following is Fortran code to read daily files, r*_wd_*.dat.
PROGRAM METDAT
C FORTRAN CODE TO READ THE FILE r1_wd_2001.dat.
REAL ATMEAN2M, ATMIN2M, ATMAX2M, RH2M, PAR2M, STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX REAL ATMEAN22M, ATMIN22M, ATMAX22M, RH22M, PAR22M, PYRAN REAL RAIN, WIND
INTEGER YEAR, DOY
CHARACTER*182 HEADER
OPEN(UNIT = 2, FILE = 'r1_wd_2001.dat', STATUS = 'OLD')

10 READ(2,*, END = 20) # YEAR, DOY, ATMEAN2M, ATMIN2M, ATMAX2M, RH2M, PAR2M, # STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX, ATMEAN22M, ATMIN22M, ATMAX22M, # RH22M, PAR22M, PYRAN, RAIN, WIND
GO TO 10
20 CLOSE(2)
STOP END

The following is C code to read daily files, r*_wd_*.dat.
#include stdio.h #include stdlib.h #include string.h
/* C program to read r1_wd_2001.dat. */
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
int rec; int YEAR, DOY;
float ATMEAN2m, ATMIN2m, ATMAX2m, RH2m, PAR2m, STMEAN, STMIN, STMAX; float ATMEAN22m, ATMIN22m, ATMAX22m, RH22m, PAR22m, PYRAN, RAIN, WIND;
char header[184];
FILE *met_fp;
if((met_fp = fopen("./r1_wd_2001.dat", "r")) == NULL) { fprintf(stderr, "Error opening file r1_wd_2001.dat.\n"); exit(EXIT_FAILURE); }
for(rec = 1; rec = 9; rec++) { fgets(header, 183, met_fp); header[strlen(header)] = '\0'; }
while(!feof(met_fp)) { if (fscanf(met_fp, "%d %d %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f\n", &YEAR, &DOY, &ATMEAN2m, &ATMIN2m, &ATMAX2m, &RH2m, &PAR2m, &STMEAN, &STMIN, &STMAX, &ATMEAN22m, &ATMIN22m, &ATMAX22m, &RH22m, &PAR22m, &PYRAN, &RAIN, &WIND) == 18); else fprintf(stderr, "Check the number of variables in r1_wd_2001.dat\n"); }
return; }
**********
CDIAC.Notes: Weather data are available for 1999-2007. There is an hourly (*wh*) and a daily (*wd*) file for each of the six plots (rings) on the FACE site, giving a total of 12 files for each year. The 2007 files will be updated as data become available. Daily statistics were calculated only for those variables with at least 12 good hourly values, and the calculation of daily statistics for the variables, PAR2m, PAR22m, and PYRAN, required 12 good daylight hours. Otherwise, the daily values were set to missing.
